thread.title: Model Emily Ratajkowski outraged at NYT journalist’s alleged insult to Melania Trump
thread.title_full: Model Emily Ratajkowski outraged at NYT journalist’s alleged insult to Melania Trump – TheBlaze

author: theblaze.com
title: Model Emily Ratajkowski outraged at NYT journalist’s alleged insult to Melania Trump
text:
Model Emily Ratajkowski says that a New York Times reporter called Melania Trump a “hooker” and she’s outraged about it.
The model related what happened on her Twitter account Monday, “Sat next to a journalist from the NYT last night who told me “Melania is a hooker.” Whatever your politics it’s crucial to call this out for what it is: slut shaming. I don’t care about her nudes or sexual history and no one should.
Sat next to a journalist from the NYT last night who told me "Melania is a hooker." Whatever your politics it's crucial to call this out for
— Emily Ratajkowski (@emrata) February 13, 2017 

what it is: slut shaming. I don't care about her nudes or sexual history and no one should.
— Emily Ratajkowski (@emrata) February 13, 2017 

Image Source: Twitter, Emily Ratajkowski. The reporter appears to have been referring to the redacted story published by the Daily Mail that is now the center of a $150 lawsui t from the first lady. The lawsuit was dismissed from a Maryland court but later re-filed in New York City by Trump. She tweeted apologies and retractions about the story from other news outlets after first filing the lawsuit. 
This is not the first time the Trump ladies have been unfairly targeted by news media outlets. In January, Fox News’ Brit Hume blasted what he called a “chickens**t” story criticizing a trifling detail about Melania on the White House website’s page about her. And in December, a Politico writer was fired for asking on her twitter account if Trump had committed incest with his daughter Ivanka. 
Ratajkowksi is no fan of President Trump however – she protested against the Muslim ban and posted about it on her social media account.
pic.twitter.com/3WMUvCNZ6x 
— Emily Ratajkowski (@emrata) January 30, 2017 

And supported Black Lives Matter.
#blacklivesmatter pic.twitter.com/MGLINWZOs7 
— Emily Ratajkowski (@emrata) January 22, 2017 

But unlike some other feminists on the left, at least Ratajkowksi is intellectually honest enough to call out sexism against the right and the left.
